intro: Solanum acroscopicum, commonly known as the acroscopic nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals, and it produces small, berry-like fruits that are toxic to humans. Due to its toxic properties, it is not cultivated for food or ornamental purposes.
